sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Division divided, or, Ruines fore-runner discovered and decyphered in a sermon before the right honourable and right worshipfull the Lord Major and Aldermen of the city of London, preached on the Lords-day, September 20, 1646, in Pauls Church, London / by one that wisheth well unto and daily prayeth for unity and uniformity in these three kingdomes. Bridges, Walter.
[7], 62 p.
Printed for Andrew Crooke, London : 1646.
"The epistle dedicatory," signed: Walter Bridges. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
=======
Division divided, or, Ruines fore-runner discovered and decyphered in a sermon before the right honourable and right worshipfull the Lord Major and Aldermen of the city of London, preached on the Lords-day, September 20, 1646, in Pauls Church, London / by one that wisheth well unto and daily prayeth for unity and uniformity in these three kingdomes. Bridges, Walter.
[7], 62 p.
Printed for Andrew Crooke, London : 1646.
"The epistle dedicatory," signed: Walter Bridges. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
Andrew Crooke
